Phr.Name: Go after
Phr.Meaning: To pursue or chase someone or something
Examples: He went after the thief who stole his wallet.
She's going after her dream of becoming an artist.
The dog went after the cat that entered the yard.
They're going after a new market for their products.
I'm going after the promotion with everything I've got.

Phr.Name: Give away
Phr.Meaning: To give something to someone without expecting payment
Examples: She gave away all her old clothes to charity.
They gave away free samples of the new product.
He gave away his books to friends before moving.
The store gave away gift cards to loyal customers.
We gave away our tickets to the concert because we couldn't attend.

Phr.Name: Give back
Phr.Meaning: To return something to its rightful owner or origin
Examples: He gave back the money he found on the street.
They're giving back to the community by volunteering.
She gave back the borrowed book to the library.
The company gives back a portion of its profits to charity.
We should give back to those who have helped us along the way.

Phr.Name: Get over
Phr.Meaning: To recover from something, such as an illness or emotional setback
Examples: She's trying to get over a bad breakup.
He got over his cold quickly with rest and medication.
They're getting over the shock of the accident.
It takes time to get over the loss of a loved one.
We need to get over our fear of failure and move forward.

Phr.Name: Get along
Phr.Meaning: To have a good relationship or rapport with someone
Examples: They get along well with their neighbors.
She finds it easy to get along with her coworkers.
Despite their differences, they manage to get along.
He gets along with everyone he meets.
It's important to get along with your classmates.

Phr.Name: Give in
Phr.Meaning: To surrender or yield to pressure or persuasion
Examples: She finally gave in to his demands.
They gave in to temptation and ate the cake.
He gave in to peer pressure and joined the group.
The government gave in to protesters' demands.
I refuse to give in to fear and will continue fighting for what's right.

Phr.Name: Go off
Phr.Meaning: To explode, make a sudden loud noise, or stop working
Examples: The alarm clock went off at 6 AM.
The fireworks went off with a bang.
The car alarm went off in the middle of the night.
The lights went off during the storm.
The bomb went off in the city center.

Phr.Name: Give out
Phr.Meaning: To distribute or provide something to others
Examples: She gave out cookies to the children at the party.
They gave out flyers to advertise the event.
He gave out instructions before starting the project.
The charity gave out blankets to the homeless.
We should give out compliments more often.

Phr.Name: Go on
Phr.Meaning: To continue or proceed
Examples: The show must go on, despite the technical difficulties.
She went on to pursue her dream of becoming an astronaut.
The meeting went on for hours without reaching a conclusion.
Life goes on, even after setbacks and challenges.
He went on with his speech despite the interruption.

Phr.Name: Give up
Phr.Meaning: To surrender, quit, or stop trying
Examples: She refused to give up, despite facing numerous obstacles.
They gave up searching for the lost treasure.
He gave up smoking for the sake of his health.
The team never gave up, even when trailing by a large margin.
I won't give up on my dreams, no matter what.

Phr.Name: Get off
Phr.Meaning: To leave a vehicle or a mode of transportation
Examples: She got off the bus at the next stop.
They got off the train at the wrong station.
He got off his bike and walked it up the hill.
The passengers got off the airplane after it landed.
We need to get off the subway at the next station.

Phr.Name: Give up on
Phr.Meaning: To stop believing in or supporting someone or something
Examples: She refused to give up on her dreams, despite the challenges.
They gave up on the idea of finding a solution.
He gave up on his friend after numerous disappointments.
The company gave up on the failing project.
We should never give up on those we care about.

Phr.Name: Get on
Phr.Meaning: To board or enter a vehicle or a mode of transportation
Examples: She got on the bus and found a seat near the window.
They got on the subway at the busy station.
He got on his bike and started pedaling.
The passengers got on the ferry to the island.
We need to get on the train before it departs.

Phr.Name: Go over
Phr.Meaning: To review, examine, or discuss something in detail
Examples: She went over the details of the project with her team.
They need to go over the contract before signing it.
He went over his notes before the exam.
The teacher went over the lesson to ensure everyone understood.
Let's go over the plan one more time to make sure it's perfect.

Phr.Name: Give in to
Phr.Meaning: To yield or submit to someone or something, especially reluctantly
Examples: She gave in to temptation and ate the chocolate cake.
They gave in to pressure and agreed to the demands.
He gave in to exhaustion and went to bed early.
The government gave in to protesters' demands after weeks of demonstrations.
We should never give in to fear.

Phr.Name: Go through
Phr.Meaning: To experience or endure something difficult or unpleasant
Examples: She went through a lot of hardship before achieving success.
They went through a tough time after losing their job.
He went through a messy divorce last year.
The company is going through a period of restructuring.
We all have to go through challenges in life.

Phr.Name: Get by
Phr.Meaning: To manage to survive or cope with a situation, especially with limited resources
Examples: She gets by on a small income by budgeting carefully.
They're just getting by until they find a new job.
He got by with the help of his friends during tough times.
The family is struggling to get by on one income.
We can get by with what we have for now.

Phr.Name: Give off
Phr.Meaning: To emit or release something, such as light, heat, or odor
Examples: The flowers gave off a pleasant fragrance.
The lamp gives off a soft glow.
The oven gives off a lot of heat when in use.
The factory gives off toxic fumes into the air.
The burning wood gives off smoke and ash.

Phr.Name: Get rid of
Phr.Meaning: To dispose of or eliminate something unwanted or unnecessary
Examples: She got rid of all the clutter in her house.
They got rid of the old furniture to make room for new ones.
He got rid of his bad habits through sheer determination.
The company decided to get rid of non-performing assets.
We need to get rid of the pests infesting our garden.

Phr.Name: Go along with
Phr.Meaning: To agree or comply with someone or something
Examples: She decided to go along with the group's decision.
They went along with the plan even though they had reservations.
He went along with his friend's suggestion for dinner.
The employees went along with the new policy without much resistance.
I'll go along with your proposal if it makes sense.

Phr.Name: Go back
Phr.Meaning: To return to a previous location or state
Examples: She decided to go back to her hometown after years of living abroad.
They went back to the restaurant where they had their first date.
He went back to school to pursue a higher degree.
The company went back to its original business model after unsuccessful experiments.
Let's go back to the drawing board and come up with a new plan.

Phr.Name: Get ahead
Phr.Meaning: To make progress or succeed, especially in relation to others
Examples: She works hard to get ahead in her career.
They managed to get ahead of the competition with innovative strategies.
He got ahead by studying diligently for his exams.
The company is always looking for ways to get ahead in the market.
You can get ahead in life by setting clear goals and working towards them.

Phr.Name: Give out
Phr.Meaning: To distribute or provide something to others
Examples: She gave out cookies to the children at the party.
They gave out flyers to advertise the event.
He gave out instructions before starting the project.
The charity gave out blankets to the homeless.
We should give out compliments more often.

Phr.Name: Go on
Phr.Meaning: To continue or proceed
Examples: The show must go on, despite the technical difficulties.
She went on to pursue her dream of becoming an astronaut.
The meeting went on for hours without reaching a conclusion.
Life goes on, even after setbacks and challenges.
He went on with his speech despite the interruption.
